title: Trump and Hegseth Recount Familiar Partisan Complaints to Top Military Leaders
summary: The U.S. generals and admirals summoned from around the world had been given little information about the planned event.

title: 5 Takeaways From Trump’s Address to Top Military Leaders
summary: The president leveraged the meeting as his chance to trumpet his domestic and foreign policy moves.

title: Trump Gave the Military’s Brass a Rehashed Speech. Until Minute 44.
summary: On an almost daily basis, thousands of words pour forth from the president’s mouth. Sometimes, he tucks in a wildly revealing insight about the direction he is taking the country.

title: Hegseth Lectures Military Brass on ‘Woke’ Leaders, Fitness and Grooming
summary: Senior officers, summoned from around the world, are entrusted to manage complex military operations. They got a lecture on fitness and grooming standards.

title: Judge Rules Trump Unlawfully Targeted Noncitizens Over Pro-Palestinian Speech
summary: In a blistering opinion, a federal judge in Boston said the Trump administration used the threat of deportations to systematically intimidate certain campus demonstrators into silence.

title: In Unusual Move, Prosecutors Secure Federal Charges From Local Grand Jury
summary: A judge, Zia M. Faruqui, said that what appeared to be a kind of grand jury forum shopping seemed to have broken “decades-long norms and the rule of law.”

title: Trump Says a Deal With Harvard Is Close
summary: The agreement, if finalized, would follow months of grappling over federal dollars as the Trump administration pressured the university in its broader push to reshape higher education.

title: Harvard Blasts Administration Over ‘Distorted’ Civil Rights Investigation
summary: The Sept. 19 letter came days before the Department of Health and Human Services started the process of cutting off federal funds to the university.

title: Judge Disqualifies Nevada’s Acting U.S. Attorney From Handling Cases
summary: A federal judge said Sigal Chattah was not “validly serving as acting U.S. attorney.” The Trump administration had appointed her to the post in a way that circumvented federal procedures.

title: Trump Announces Pfizer Deal to Lower Some Drug Prices and Unveils TrumpRx Website
summary: The administration also announced it will create a website, TrumpRx, that will help consumers buy drugs directly from manufacturers.

title: Trump Administration Moves to Relax Rules on Hydrofluorocarbons
summary: The E.P.A. plan would allow grocery stores, air-conditioning manufacturers and others to phase out hydrofluorocarbons in cooling equipment more slowly.

title: Trump Cuts to Counterterrorism Funds for New York Reach $187 Million
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York asked that the funding be restored, accusing the Trump administration of “walking away from the fight against terrorism.”

title: Release of Democrat’s Naval Record Scrambles a Tight Governor’s Race
summary: In the New Jersey governor’s race, Mikie Sherrill, the Democrat, is locked in a bitter battle with Jack Ciattarelli, the Republican, over the release of records tied to her military service.

title: The Artist Who Lived in a Cage For a Year
summary: At Dia Beacon, a retrospective looks at the career of Tehching Hsieh, whose yearlong performance art pieces were some of the most grueling the medium has ever seen.

title: Scores Accused of Immigration Fraud in Federal Sweep in Minnesota
summary: The investigation is the “first of many” targeted at U.S. cities, said Joseph B. Edlow, the director of U.S.C.I.S.

title: Full Federal Appeals Court to Hear Alien Enemies Act Case
summary: The decision vacated a finding by a panel of the court’s judges regarding President Trump’s use of the Alien Enemies Act to deport immigrants, but did not clear the way for such expulsions to resume.

title: Earthquake in Philippines Kills at Least 20, Officials Say
summary: The magnitude 6.9 earthquake shook the province of Cebu, home to 3.2 million people, just before 10 p.m. local time.

title: A.I. Fighter Jets and Cockroach Spies: Inside the Changing Business of War
summary: Russia’s war on Ukraine changed the course of a generation of start-ups and investors that have applied a new business model to Europe’s military buildup.

title: Russia’s Military Budget Shrinks as War Costs Hit Kremlin’s Economic Limits
summary: The budget indicates that Russia will continue to fight largely as it has, locking it in a grinding war of attrition.

title: The Looming Shutdown Is About Obamacare
summary: What the looming shutdown is really about: Republicans trying to repeal Obamacare.

title: Trump’s Generals Speech Was Political Theater
summary: The military was again used as a backdrop for Trump’s clashes in America’s culture wars, testing the armed services’ nonpartisan, apolitical nature.

title: Long Covid Risk for Children Doubles After a Second Infection, Study Finds
summary: The new research provides evidence that Covid reinfections can increase the risk of long-term health consequences.

title: Nicole Kidman Files for Divorce From Keith Urban After Nearly 20 Years
summary: The couple married in Australia in 2006. Their breakup surprised many fans.

title: How Zohran Mamdani Built a Campaign Around Food
summary: The front-runner for New York mayor is leveraging his lifelong love of eating to inform his policy plans and spread his message.

title: Thomas Perry Dies at 78; Writer of Popular, Unconventional Thrillers
summary: His many novels, including the prizewinning “The Butcher’s Boy” and the Jane Whitefield series, can have readers rooting for both protagonist and antagonist.
